name: Middlemarch Rm, Historic S.Boston Home w/Breakfast
neighborhood_overview: Many cafés and restaurants are a short block away on Broadway, as well as pubs, bars, and other colorful watering holes. John is happy to offer suggestions based on what you’re in the mood for. We are a short bus ride to the beach, Kelly’s Landing, and Castle Island. Dorchester Heights is a few blocks uphill for views of the city and access to a revolutionary historic site. Continuing down the steep side of this hill will deposit you at Carson Beach, with its broad boulevard-wide sidewalks perfect for long, leisurely strolls or bicycle rides.
description:
Nolan House is a comfortable Victorian home, convenient to The Boston Convention Center, the Seaport, and the MBTA (or the “T”, to locals) which opens all of Boston & Cambridge to exploration. We’re on a quiet street right off Broadway, and offer a frequently changing selection of breakfast items every morning, providing a solid start to your day. Many local establishments are a close block away, extending down Broadway in both directions, from cafés & restaurants, to upscale bars & casual pubs.

The space
The Middlemarch is a charming room, full of character & warmth, located on the second floor of an older Victorian home. It boasts an extremely comfortable full-size bed, with a day-bed that can serve as an additional single bed, allowing for an economical option for either friends traveling together, or a couple with an older child.
